Text: [Michael] When I spoke with Dave Eshelman
about his role as a Stanford Prison Experiment guard,
he told me about the inspiration
for his infamous persona.
[film narrator] The guards were not allowed to beat the prisoners,
so they fell back on the familiar military technique
of ordering push-ups to humiliate them.
[Dave] My role model, I pulled it from two places.
I'd just gone through fraternity hazing.
-Ah, yeah. -And the second thing is,
I had just seen the movie Cool Hand Luke.
And the prison warden is this great character actor
named Strother Martin.
And he was famous for his line that went,
"Now, boys, what we have here is a failure to communicate."
Not just the line, but the accent is famous.
And you adopted an accent in this experiment.
[Dave] You know, I figured, I'm going to be
one goddamn mean sumbitch Southern guard.
[film narrator] That's prisoner 416 on the floor,
as he was forced into solitary.
What name did you go by during the experiment?
Well, I found out later
that they started calling me John Wayne.
John Wayne. How did that nickname come about?
Well, it's interesting how that happened,
because, you know, John Wayne,
he was seen as the establishment, the enemy.
Most of the kids in my generation,
they were out protesting against the war in Vietnam.
John Wayne, the actor, who had come out in favor...
-Yeah. -...of the war in Vietnam.
So immediately, to us kids, he was evil.
Right. John Wayne was not a hero.
No, he was not a hero to these kids.
Somehow, that name stuck to me.
But, you know, I don't think John Wayne ever played a part
like the one that I'm playing here.
-No, no. -In fact, at the end,
Zimbardo made it a point to come over to me
and say, "You were fantastic."
-Like a director might. Right. -Like a director might,
you know, at the end of a performance.
Have you done any media appearances
since the Ben Blum article came out?
No.
So, what was your reaction to those new criticisms?
Well, I felt like the Dude in The Big Lebowski
when he said, "New shit has come to light, man."
-[laughs] Yeah. -Basically, I'm saying,
This is what I've been telling people
from the very beginning,
that doesn't make it into the final cut.
Right.
